text: hey there fellow travelers and day job
workers yes I actually have a day job
the traveling thing is not my full-time
job okay I wish it was but we're not
quite there yet and so what I have for
you is four things you should do before
you go on vacation so things work a
little bit better at work while you're
gone and that you're better prepared to
get back to work when you do head back
okay now the first thing is make sure
you set that auto reply on your email so
people are not trying to find you and
stuff like that have it on they're
saying when you're gonna be back who are
the people that they should contact if
they have an emergency and all these
kind of things that's the first thing I
know it seems silly but you'd be
surprised how many people forget to do
that and their clients are sending
emails like where the hell is he is like
oops I forgot the time I was going to be
going that's the first thing you should
do the second thing you need to do is
make sure you arrange with your
co-workers who's taking over your work
if you've got clients coming in who's
gonna be dealing with them I know when I
worked as a stockbroker you know if we
were gonna be away we had to set things
up with our with our clients and with
art with other stockbrokers hey I'm big
on will you make the trades for us and
things like that and so you had just
kind of arranged all those things out
there and when you're gonna be setting
up this stuff don't rub it in like yeah
I'm gonna be in Rome and Italy for like
two weeks while you're slaving here away
at the desk and all these kind of things
don't rub it in because then your
co-workers said to not help you as much
now my third tip has to deal with when
you come back and what I would say is
clear your calendar off so that first
day you're back you're not meeting
clients and doing all these things
because you're gonna have hundreds maybe
thousands of emails I mean it happens
sometimes waiting for you and you're
gonna need that day just to kind of plow
through them so don't schedule anything
really important that first day back
because what happens is I've got a lot
of people that they're going okay I've
got my two-week vacation I'm gonna get
back Sunday night at like midnight
you're like yeah but if you miss one
flight that first day back you're gonna
miss you're not gonna be back in time
for work and I've had friends getting
really big trouble from their bosses so
make sure you have a light schedule in
that first day cuz you're gonna be a
deal with jetlag and getting back to the
grind and all these kind of things so
schedule a light day on your first day
back and that kind of leads in to the
fourth recommendation I have for you is
one thing is if you are gonna be coming
back why not give yourself a buffer
I know we want to spend as much time as
we can in Europe or or Mexico or the
Caribbean or wherever but think about it
you're coming back Sunday night late
you're gonna be tired at work the next
day and it's not gonna be that helpful
you got to go through your bills in the
mail and all these kind of things well
why not come back on Saturday night and
then you have that buffer day on Sunday
so you could maybe start on those emails
or get your mail done or get you know
the lawn mowed at your house these kind
of things so you're getting kind of back
into the groove things before you get
back to work because I see a lot of
people it takes them a couple days to
kind of get back in the groove after a
good vacation and having that extra day
helps you adjust your personal life and
your professional life so when you're
back to actual work work things are
running smoothly because you don't want
your boss thinking oh there's Walters
going on vacation again who's gonna be
worthless when he comes back you don't
want that because you want to be able to
go whenever it takes and there's no kind
of like drop-off in productivity when
you come back anyway those little things
that I do we when I travel what are some
of the advice you have for people to do
for work before they go away put in the
comment section below so we can help out
other worker travelers like myself and
like yourself out there if you wanna
learn more five things you're love and
hate about working abroad ten things to
consider before you move abroad
check us out our website at Walter's
world comm we're also on Twitter
Facebook Instagram and we really
appreciate your likes and subscriptions
and you know what if you're working hard
god bless you because hey we've all got
to be working hard to enjoy our vacation
so bye from room
